ABOUT US
Johnston Vere is a global recruitment consultancy that actually consults! We offer a mix of broad industry knowledge, technical expertise, and success in recruitment at the highest level.
For over 25 years we have been partnering world-class technology, software and engineering companies; sourcing key executive, management, technical and commercial personnel throughout the world.
Our aim is to develop long term relationships with clients. We integrate ourselves fully within client organisations to holistically understand their business and requirements. Today Johnston Vere follows the legacy of the lifecycle ethos where many of our candidates have since become clients; this is reflected in the exceptionally high level of repeat business and their recommendations.

CURRENT REQUIREMENTS
Dekra Organisational & Process Safety currently requires assistance developing their UK Business Development team through the recruitment of a Senior Business Development Manager. This individual will be expected to proactively develop and lead sales efforts in the company’s key offerings within Organisational Reliability (OR), Process Safety (PS), and Organisational Process Safety (OS).
This person will have a strategic involvement and will be encouraged to bring an entrepreneurial creativity to help grow the DEKRA brand in the UK, in particular Organisational and Process Safety. They will be a self-motivated person that sees a project through to conclusion and understands when and how to reach out to experts in the business to create the best solutions for Dekra’s clients.
We need a sales / BD professional who adopts a true consultative sales approach and can design a solution which adds proven value when it comes to solving a client’s bespoke challenge / environment. This individual will need to bring a proven track record of achieving £MM sales revenues with strategic target customers.
Senior Business Development Manager:
Core Responsibilities:
To develop knowledge to competently sell services in PS/OR and help develop the niche overlap areas (e.g. human factors)
Establish, develop, and maintain relationships with clients to grow accounts and ensure DEKRA has impact and delivers quality for the clients
For designated key accounts and prospects, develop stakeholder understanding and utilise this to improve DOPS resilience, reversing the bow tie
Meet or exceed agreed sales targets by working to the agreed strategy
Drive the sales pipeline and ensure good collaboration throughout the business lines
Identify, develop, and realise sales revenue with new clients, business, and product opportunities
Support the VP BD to diversify the client portfolio
Work collaboratively with marketing to agree strategies, and to ensure that DEKRA is recognised as a thought leader in specialist areas
Recognise farming opportunities with new stakeholders, business, and product opportunities. Proactively investigate new opportunities with clients and affiliates. Identify potential for additional sales (upsell and cross-sell)
Record opportunities on the central management system and update the VP BD regularly on BD initiatives and activities undertaken
Optimal communication (verbal and written) to encourage transparency and share opportunities throughout the network
Support the VP BD with sales forecasting for multiple audiences
Issuing quotations and converting these to orders
Effectively support, coach and mentor other members of BD team
Work collaboratively to maintain existing accounts and establish and embed a sustainable partnering approach to relationship management
Continuously looks for opportunities to improve personal and team performance
Customer Management Responsibilities:
To provide professional and effective services to internal and / or external clients, to meet their expectations
To communicate courteously with internal and / or external clients by telephone, email, and face to face, building positive relationships, responding to and progressing issues and queries to a successful conclusion at the earliest time
Speak positively and enthusiastically about the company and its products and services to ensure that a professional company and brand image is always provided to clients and colleagues.
To work as part of a team to achieve the departmental standards
To work together with other departments within DEKRA to identify any process improvements and improve standards, efficiency, and profitability
Respectfully challenge at all levels to ensure DEKRA provides its best service to its clients and staff
The Candidate:
Candidates should have:
Minimum of 7 years related experience in consulting sales, (preferably high hazard industries)
Understands consultative selling approach & experience
Track record of delivering £1M+ programmes and multiple projects concurrently
Demonstrable, successful experience in developing and delivering new product solutions in an evolving market
Proven negotiation skills at a high level
The proven ability to develop and drive a sustainable pipeline of opportunities
Previous experience of managing / driving sales campaigns with associated project management skills
Tenacious and target driven
To be confident and have experience in conference speaking
Self-starter who is adaptable, flexible, and creative
Excellent understanding of delivery and sales
Degree or equivalent (desirable).
Team player with a real ability to network and collaborate.
General Business/Industry awareness with an ability to identify opportunities.
Strategic thinking with analytical skills.
Candidates should be:
Intelligent and highly motivated
Enthusiastic about learning new skills
Location: UK – option to be home based but candidate must have the flexibility and desire to move between DEKRA UK offices and client sites. Travel required up to 50% of the time (National & International).
Salary Indicator: Based on our discussions with Mark, we would expect the base salary to be in the region of £65,000 - £75,000 but with potential to go above this for an exceptional candidate with proven pedigree.
Additional benefits – Bonus (up to 15% of salary), company car, private BUPA healthcare, life assurance, contributory pension (5%/5%).
THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS
FEE STRUCTURE

All charges are subject to Value Added Tax at the current rate where applicable.
Expenses
The costs applicable in respect of the Retainer are in relation to the Client’s initial instructions to and/or appointment of the Company and all preparatory work undertaken whether or not on after or before the signing of this agreement. As part of the assignment service we provide, all candidates put forward at shortlist stage will have been personally interviewed and vetted. The expense allocation for interviews, meetings, travel, sustenance, etc. is payable by the client on receipt of invoice. This budget will be up to a maximum of £1,000, but clearly Johnston Vere will endeavour to keep these costs to an absolute minimum.
GUARANTEE
In the event of payment having been received in accordance with our payment terms, then in the event of a candidate leaving of their own volition, we operate a sliding scale refund system:
If the candidate leaves within 4 weeks, 75% of the final fee is refunded.
If the candidate leaves within 8 weeks, 50% of the final fee is refunded.
If the candidate leaves within 12 weeks, 25% of the final fee is refunded.
Alternatively, a client can elect a replacement candidate in lieu of a refund.
INDUSTRIES
Each of our consultants operate in their own field of expertise, which when appreciated as a whole, offers clients and candidates a truly holistic market, technology or discipline based approach.
Each domain in which we work offers its own challenges such as limited candidate pools or niche technologies. 
Our market knowledge and experience enables us to devise effective search plans allowing us to resource from nontypical environments to source candidates with transferrable skills.
